item.title: Sarat add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "I think I've discovered the secret of life -- you just hang around until you get used to it." -- Charles Schultz

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Laura Ingalls Wilder
item.description: "The real things haven't changed. It is still best to be honest and truthful; to make the most of what we have; to be happy with simple pleasures; and have courage when things go wrong." -- Laura Ingalls Wilder

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Agatha Christi
item.description: "I like living. I have sometimes been wildly, despairingly, acutely miserable, racked with sorrow; but through it all I still know quite certainly that just to be alive is a grand thing." -- Agatha Christi

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "A poem begins as a lump in the throat, a sense of wrong, a homesickness, a lovesickness." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Tim O'Brien
item.description: "But in a story, which is a kind of dreaming, the dead sometimes smile and sit up and return to the world." -- Tim O'Brien

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Woodrow Wilson
item.description: "You have the greatest soul, the noblest nature, the sweetest, most loving heart I have ever known, and my love, my reverence, my admiration for you, you have increased in one evening as I should have thought only a lifetime of intimate, loving association could have increased them. You are more wonderful and lovely in my eyes than you ever were before; and my pride and joy and gratitude that you should love me with such a perfect love are beyond all expression, except in some great poem which I cannot write." -- Woodrow Wilson

item.title: Sarat add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "Strange, that some of us, with quick alternative vision, see beyond our infatuations, and even while we rave on the heights, behold the wide plain where our persistent self pauses and awaits us." -- George Eliot

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Emily Brontë
item.description: "I 'never told my love' vocally; still, if looks have language, the merest idiot might have guessed I was over head and ears;" -- Emily Brontë

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you simply, without problems or pride: I love you in this way because I do not know any other way of loving but this, in which there is no I or you, so intimate that your hand upon my chest is my hand, so intimate that when I fall asleep your eyes close." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "As it has been said: Love and a cough cannot be concealed. Even a small cough. Even a small love." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "One morning I shot an elephant in my pajamas. How he got in my pajamas I'll never know." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Well, art is art, isn't it? Still, on the other hand, water is water! And east is east and west is west and if you take cranberries and stew them like applesauce they taste much more like prunes than rhubarb does. Now, uh... now you tell me what you know." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I'm not crazy about reality, but it's still the only place to get a decent meal." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sarat add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "Blessed is the man who, having nothing to say, abstains from giving us wordy evidence of the fact." -- George Eliot

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "The problem with the world is that the intelligent people are full of doubts, while the stupid ones are full of confidence." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Find what you love and let it kill you." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Things get bad for all of us, almost continually, and what we do under the constant stress reveals who/what we are." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "It is a curious thought, but it is only when you see people looking ridiculous that you realize just how much you love them. " -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "Time is the best killer." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "I don't think necessity is the mother of invention. Invention . . . arises directly from idleness, possibly also from laziness. To save oneself trouble." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Faith in God means believing absolutely in something with no proof whatsoever. Faith in humanity means believing absolutely in something with a huge amount of proof to the contrary. We are the true believers." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Sarat add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "The absurd is the essential concept and the first truth." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Sarat add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "I have been astonished that men could die martyrs for their religion-- I have shuddered at it, I shudder no more. I could be martyred for my religion. Love is my religion and I could die for that. I could die for you. My Creed is Love and you are its only tenet." -- John Keats

item.title: Sarat add a quote by William Penn
item.description: "They that love beyond the world cannot be separated by it. Death cannot kill what never dies. Nor can spirits ever be divided, that love and live in the same divine principle, the root and record of their friendship. If absence be not death, neither is theirs. Death is but crossing the world, as friends do the seas; they live in one another still. For they must needs be present, that love and live in that which is omnipresent. In this divine glass they see face to face; and their converse is free, as well as pure. This is the comfort of friends, that though they may be said to die, yet their friendship and society are, in the best sense, ever present, because immortal." -- William Penn

item.title: Sarat add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "There is an expiry date on blaming your parents for steering you in the wrong direction; the moment you are old enough to take the wheel, responsibility lies with you." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Sarat add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "But the years came and went without bringing the careless boy; and when they met again Wendy was a married woman, and Peter was no more to her than a little dust in the box in which she had kept her toys." -- J.M. Barrie
